intro: Draba daurica, commonly known as Daurian rockcress, is a low-growing perennial herb native to the cold climates of eastern Asia. It typically reaches heights of 5–15 cm and features basal leaves that are oblanceolate to elliptic in shape. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers in clusters during the spring. It thrives in rocky or gravelly soils and is often found in alpine or arctic environments. Draba daurica is characterized by its hardy nature and ability to survive in harsh, nutrient-poor conditions.
